metadata.titel_preek: Philadelphia: The Keepers Are Kept, Part 2

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of the letter to Philadelphia, focusing on the concept of 'covenant', historical biblical covenants (Abraham, Exodus), and the eschatological 'hour of temptation'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-theological framing; uses cross-references (Genesis, Romans, Matthew) to define 'covenant'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from explaining the nature of a covenant to asserting the certainty of God's protection, culminating in a rhythmic promise of 'I will keep thee'.
voorbeelden: I will keep thee.
I will make thee a pillar in the house of my God.
I will write upon him my new name.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, assurance of security amidst global chaos, and a sense of belonging/identity (being 'labeled').
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; mentions 'allowing the spirit of the Lord to permeate', but focuses more on Christ's objective promise.

voorbeelden: This text takes on added significance.
Abraham believed God.
The plague of AIDS has descended upon the world.
Look around.
Read Matthew 26.
Hold that fast which thou hast.
I take great comfort in that.
I wish I could stay here a while.
What an awful thing.
I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation.
I will make thee a pillar.
I will write upon him the name of my God.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High; the preacher repeats the divine 'I will' as a direct pledge to the congregation.

voorbeelden: I am ready for him.
I am labeled.
I am bound for the Promised Land.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher declares his own status as a representative of the congregation's status.

indicatoren: Long sections on the definition of 'covenant'.
Extended social commentary on drugs and AIDS (talking about the world).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Informative but risks distancing the hearer from the immediate 'event' of the Word.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives the promise but not a direct change of state (declaration).

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Excellent; uses the 'I will keep thee' litany to bridge the text to the hearer's life.
voorbeelden: In youth... I will keep thee.
In the middle years... I will keep thee.
When the sun goes down... I will keep thee.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal testimony and homiletical 'I' ('I believe', 'I say to you').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation ('I will keep thee', 'Are you ready?').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Strongly used in the commissive section.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Philadelphia, Abraham, and the current state of the world.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative foundation before the direct address.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Definitions of covenants and descriptions of social ills.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the promise and the 'Now' of the tribulation.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the definition of covenant (Assertive) to the specific promise of Christ (Commissive) and concludes with the identity of the believer (Declarative).
voorbeelden: God is a covenant God -> I will keep thee -> I am labeled.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strong; the 'I will keep thee' section is the performative engine of the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because thou hast kept... I also will keep.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a 'Toezegging' (Promise). It uses the biblical text not just as information, but as a vehicle to deliver divine assurance to a modern audience.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The repetition of 'I will keep thee' across different life stages.
sterke_punten.effect: Transforms the sermon from a lecture into a protective event.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The section on drug statistics and federalization.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Shifts the focus from the Word to sociological observation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' when the preacher stops talking about Philadelphia and starts speaking for Christ to the people.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'I am labeled' acts as a declarative seal on the hearer's identity.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the preacher adopts the 'I' of Christ in the promises.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: High; the preacher speaks with authority regarding the 'labeling' of the soul.
tekstueel_bewijs: I say to you with all my heart, I am ready for him.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Moderate; mentions the Spirit saturating the person.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher presents the Word and expects it to 'keep' the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: allowing the spirit of the Lord to permeate...
I will write upon him my new name.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is well-balanced but leans heavily on description in the middle section.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Bible talks of the great tribulation.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The Lord warns you today of a great sifting.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a report to a direct warning (Directive/Assertive).

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Occasional 'we'/third person distance during the social critique.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to bring the crisis home.
voorbeeldzinnen: In your neighborhood, in your home...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The indicative of God's keeping is already the dominant force.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of how the 'Toezegging' (Promise) can turn a historical text into a present-day sanctuary for the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about being ready for Christ; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' act of God labeling the believer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'I will keep thee' litany for its pathos; SAT values it for its illocutionary force as a Commissive act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the description of the 'tribulation' (Assertive) but in the 'labeling' of the hearer (Declarative).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I will keep thee from the hour of temptation.

appendices.notities: The preacher effectively uses the 'I' of the text (Christ) to perform the act of promising to the 'you' of the congregation.
